page.title: 10Kettlethorpe Local History
page.content: The local history of our area is very varied and interesting. Kettlethorpe takes its name from Ketel the Dane who sailed up the Trent in 870 a.d. and had his farm there. Nowadays Kettlethorpe is famous because of its association with Katherine Swynford, the mistress,and third wife of John of Gaunt. All that remains of the fourteenth century manor house is the gateway and portions of the moat, but since publication, in 1954 of Anya Seton's book "Katherine", visitors have comfrom all over the world. The present Hall was rebuilt in 1863, but includes some parts of an older eighteenth century Hall. The church of St.Peter and St.Paul, originally a medieval building,was altered and reconstructed in 1809.The graveyard contains several interesting headstones, some as old as 15OO.
